name: Holiday Inn Express Lompoc

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not find the HIE to be "worn out", and in fact thought it a nice place to stay. Staff was friendly and helpful, rooms (including bathroom and carpet) were spotless, comfortably furnished with excellent beds. It was quiet- our rooms were in the back. No complaints.
reviews.title: pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We wanted to go skydiving at Skydive Santa Barbara and this was the best deal we found in the area. Our room was clean and comfortable, the receptionists were always really nice and helpful, the complimentary breakfast was great.. we really have no complaints.
reviews.title: We had a great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the price, the facility is shabby. The carpet in our room was stained and worn out at the bathroom sink. The furniture in the room had stains and the the breakfast room chairs were disgusting. Evidence of the attitude of the management was the awful quality of the tissues in the bathroom. They were made in China and were small and rough. Avoid this motel if you can.
reviews.title: Worn Out Facility

reviews.text: My son and I joined my husband on a short business trip. The room had 2 queen beds and was clean* and very comfortable. The beds had pillow top mattress. The air conditioner worked well. The carpet was very worn in the room (almost threadbare in traffic areas) and needs replacing. There was a coffee maker, however there is 24 hour coffee in the breakfast room so we didn't use it. There was also a microwave and mini-refrig. *Our only compaint was that after dinner we went to put leftovers in the refrig and found previous guests rotting, smelly food: YUCK. Husband took this dripping spoiled food outside . Staff was friendly and breakfast was nice. There are also fast food restaurants within walking distance .Will probably stay here again as there isnt a lot of choice in Lompoc
reviews.title: Often stay at Holiday Inn Express

reviews.text: Another couple and ourselves had 2 rooms for 1 night to prolong our wonderful trip to the Santa Ynez Valley.The rooms were bright, fresh, clean, and the beds were very comfortable.-they could have been brand new.It was close to good restaurants and other wine tasting areas.Would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Clean ,New,and Very Comfortable

reviews.text: Stayed one night on a business trip. Check in was a bit slow, but not excessive and the front desk staff was very polite and friendly. Small business center with one computer and printer; convenient for airline check in and printing boarding passes. I had a large king bed room on the second floor of the main building. The room was very spacious with a large seating area, microwave and refrigerator. Although the hotel is fairly new, the room carpet was pretty well worn, but overall the room was very nice and also very quiet. Sleep quality was excellent. The hotel has a small fitness room with two treadmills and a couple bikes. Free breakfast was quite good. Overall I think this is a good location for business travelers. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Good location for business travelers

reviews.text: With an 8-year-old, 10-year-old, and a 7month old, we choose the bigger room with the pull-out sofa. We weren't disappointed! Plenty of room for the pack-and-play and for all to run (and crawl) around! If we had stayed more than one night, we would have used the mini fridge and microwave. There were a couple of fast restaurants within walking distance, and a Starbucks across the street. The breakfast in the morning was good, coffee and tea was available around the clock, with coffee in the room as well. The staff was very friendly and took extra time to make sure our check in was informative. We stayed here so we could go to the Mission the next day, which was an easy 5-minute drive. Would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Spacious Room!

reviews.text: Stopped by at this hotel as I went through the coast. Rooms were a bit pricier than other hotels in the area ($112/night - AAA rate), but I did not mind paying more since they offer larger rooms. The staff was courteous. Breakfast was available in the morning. Not the typical continental breakfast (omelets, biscuits, gravy, oatmeal, yogurt, etc.). There was ample parking and free wi-fi. This hotel is close to many sites in the area.
reviews.title: Clean, nice staff, and large rooms.

reviews.text: Excellent value, providing large, clean rooms, with parking and wi-fi. Service is non existent and breakfast is very ordinary.
reviews.title: Clean, large rooms, but not a lot more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, given a dirth of good value places to stay in Lompoc, you can do a lot worse than Holiday Inn Express.
reviews.title: Close to Solvang and Wineries

reviews.text: Stayed here in Lompoc overnight. I selected this hotel after reading reviews on the TripAdvisor site along with the best location to the event.
reviews.title: Good Night's Sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was clean and close to shopping and restaurants. The room was large with 2 beds and a sofa bed. The carpet showed signs of fading from the sunlight although the room looked newer, but otherwise the room was fine.
reviews.title: Surprisingly pleasant

reviews.text: We had the breakfast the next day which had good attendance but the room was too small for all the tables and the hotel guests. I saw a few guests taking their breakfast out to their room which is a good option as we opted to eat in the dining area which felt cramped.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall it was a good experience and would stay again if in Lompoc.
reviews.title: Completely Satisfactory

reviews.text: In our trip up the California coast, this was the only chain hotel that we stayed in. It was meant to be just a place to sleep during our drive from San Diego to Big Sur, but both Lompoc and the hotel were a pleasant surprise. Our room was huge, with a big bathroom and plenty of places to store our stuff, as well as ample outlets for recharging our phones and cameras. The bed was the most comfortable of our entire trip: king-size and very firm. Breakfast was good as well (cinnamon rolls!), although it was noisy in the breakfast room. We had an excellent dinner at Sissy's Uptown Cafe and enjoyed wandering around La Purisima mission the next morning (see separate reviews).
reviews.title: Overnight stay

reviews.text: Just stayed the one night and found the location here very good as short walk to shops and a couple of eateries. Was lucky enough to see a rocket taking off from the nearby airbase when walking to the shops!
reviews.title: Good place to stay in Lompoc

reviews.text: The rooms are large here and parking is free and no problem. The room was also clean and we had a quiet night. It ticked all the boxes for a stop off on the way up the coast.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel...excellent stay!

reviews.text: Kind of a Western/adobe feel.
reviews.title: Good and cheap place compared to the hotels by the coast

reviews.text: Staff was pleasant.
reviews.title: Not worth it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were clean.
reviews.title: Good Hotel in the right spot

description: Located in the heart of the Central Coast, Lompoc is nestled in the majestic Sta. Rita Hills and is easily accessible from Hwy 1 and Hwy 246. The Holiday Inn Express Lompoc invites you to enjoy and experience the beauty of the Valley of the Flowers and the City of Murals. At the Holiday Inn Express take advantage of the surrounding areas and tourist attractions minutes from relaxing beaches, beautiful golf courses, world renowned wineries, the Western Spaceport Vandenberg Air Force Base and the Santa Ynez Valley; including the Chumash Casino and the Danish Village of Solvang. Our weather, scenery and remote locations are ideal for a romantic getaway or a leisurely family vacation.Our smoke free hotel offers 90 fresh up to date rooms, including junior suites for our long term and family travelers. Plush bedding, free services including high speed internet and the convenience of a mini fridge/microwave combo in every room will make your stay with us an enjoyable experience. Our expanded Express Start breakfast bar is a great start to any day and our year round outdoor heated pool and Jacuzzi will help you unwind and relax-California style! Enjoy our new fitness room, complimentary business center and exceptional service; our staff eagerly awaits your arrival.
